data.title: Small town charm
data.text: When you first look from the outside you think is it going to be a good time.  By the time your nights over you have answered your question with a huge YES and a full belly.  The food is fantastic and the interior is quaint.  This is definitely a lovely place to eat.

data.title: Wonderful  selection of food at great prices
data.text: This bistro was amazing! Try their crab soup and you will surely return again and again. I liked that there were so many different dishes with not too much food, though certainly not stingy. I had the Oriental Salad. The dressing was purely sinful!! Can't wait to visit again and try something different.

data.title: Casual Elegance
data.text: This little gem is our favorite place for a special night out. Although it seems a dressy place, you will often find folks in here in their shorts. The menu has a fun variety of unique specialties with a southern flair. The crab soup is a wonderful, and shrimp and grits a favorite.  Occasionally there is live music (a guitarist singing 70's pop tunes one night we dined) on weekends or holidays. Service is attentive, but not rushed. It's the perfect place to have dinner before a night at the Davis Theater.

data.title: Not sure it's worth the price to eat here often
data.text:
My Mom, daughter and I had lunch here recently and it was really nice for a change. My Mom and I started with the crab soup, which was very good, then she and I had salads while my daughter had the Philly cheesesteak sandwich. The salads were nice and fresh -- my Mom had the Asian salad, I had the one that came with steak and warm bacon dressing (don't remember the name of it). I couldn't tell my dressing was warm and it honestly didn't taste very bacon-y to me. I tried to order extra dressing with it when our server took our order, because I always find I need just a little more than they put on it, but she discouraged me, saying it already had a lot on it. She said if I didn't think it was enough, she'd be happy to bring me more, but by the time I started eating it, I didn't want to wait for more dressing or feel like a glutton because she'd already said it was plenty. So, I ended up taking some of my Mom's extra Asian dressing, which I thought was a lot better than my bacon dressing, and adding it to my salad. So, my lunch missed the mark by that much. My daughter said her sandwich was really good, but she didn't seem too excited when she said it. 

The atmosphere is a little stuffy for me and one in which I felt I should talk quietly and "act like a lady," which is still hard for me to do at 52. So, I don't think I would feel comfortable bringing little kids here (at least not mine when they were small). There is a small patio area where you can eat outside, which might be more casual if you need/like that, but it's right on the sidewalk without much room to feel like you're not eating in street traffic to me. 

This place is a bit on the pricey side, which I only mention because I'm not sure the food is actually worth the price. I realize they are trying to appeal to a more selected clientele (ladies' lunches, business men, etc.) but I think the price of the food overshoots its quality just a bit. 

The restaurant serves lunch, dinner, and brunch, so we got menus to take with us. They also deliver within their area, which would be nice to try if we lived closer. There were a lot of things that looked enticing on their menu and I believe the food is good enough to come back and try something different another time and even at another service...just not so good that I'm willing to pay to do it often.

data.title: Quiet dinner with my wife
data.text: What a lovely hidden jem in downtown Concord.  We had a night to ourselves and wanted to try something new. I found this place through tripadvisor and thought we would give it a try. The pork was excellent. We had two very nice meals at what I consider very reasonable prices. We will be back.  P.S.  Try the cheesecake.

data.title: Nice Atmosphere
data.text: We went here for a friend's birthday dinner.  The atmosphere was pleasant and our waitress was very attentive.  I am only rating it "average" because I had a crab cake sandwich and it was not very good.  The crab was bitter and had many pieces of shell in it.  I think that I just ordered the wrong thing because the others with me enjoyed their meals.  I am looking forward to going back and trying something else.  I would recommend making reservations on the weekends.

data.title: Amazing
data.text:
My husband and went with some friends and it was an amazing experience. My husband is very picky and doesn't like many restaurants but he enjoyed this one a lot. 
 The food is amazing and the decor is very pretty and very relaxing. 
 I also went another time for a ladies brunch and it just felt so southern and so much fun.
 The only down fall is that the restaurant has weird hours so make sure you call and confirm hours. But make sure you try a dessert and a glass of wine :)
  The staff is very friendly!

data.title: Small town elegance.
data.text: We have been going to the Union Street Bistro for years.  We enjoy the small town atmosphere, the service and of course the food.  If you are visiting or live near Concord try this quaint restaurant they will impress you.

data.title: Evening with friends
data.text: The reservations were for 6 PM? We were promptly seated and a fun evening began. Server was very attentive and food was excellent. We had a table for 8 at the rear of the dining room. It was ideal seating for our group. We were able to carry on conversations without disturbing the other patrons.

data.title: Food is really good; loved the Crab Soup
data.text: The food was really good with the Crab Soup being Superb.  My husband said his steak was probably the best that he had in a while.  Salads are fresh.  Atmosphere is nice.  They have brunch on Sunday's only.

data.title: Nice restaurant and nice meal
data.text:
We eat at the Union Street Bistro a couple of times a year.  We really like the large variety of selections on the menu.  Our most recent trip we had the lobster dip appetizer which was very good.  My wife always likes their trout because she never fixes it at home.  I had the pork calvados with risotto and vegetables.  They featured a $2 beer special from the bar.  
The service was the usual fantastic.  Our waitress was very attentive and kept the water glasses filled.
This is one of the best restaurants in downtown Concord.

data.title: Great Atmosphere
data.text: We had a nice dinner tonight at the Union St. Bistro.  We went on recommendations given on Trip Advisor.  The restaurant has a nice decorative appeal and good food.  We had called in a reservation, and the nice and pleasant young lady gave us a window seat on the bar side.  We ordered the filets, and they had an excellent taste.  The steaks looked a little small when they arrived, especially for the price, however, they were very thick.  We enjoyed our salads, bread and butter, and vegetables, as well.  The salads do not come with the meal.  We should've asked about substitutions, but on the menu it noted a salad could be added to the entree for $2, and that's what we did.  There were a couple of things that could have made this very good 4 star restaurant into an excellent 5 star for us.  The biggest thing was our server.  We had everything we needed, but there was still a lack of personal attention.  I think a lot of the customers were locals that she knew, and it wasn't a big deal, but it wasn't 5 star service.  Also, forgive me for being picky, but the small tomatoes in the salad had shriveled peel, the au gratin potatoes were a little dry, and it would've been nice if the windows weren't quite so dirty when being fortunate enough to be given a window seat.  Thanks again to the young hostess for doing that for us.  All in all, it is a great little restaurant in the downtown/historic section of Concord.  As frequent visitors to Concord Mall, it is a little bit off the beaten path for us, but it is definitely a worthwhile restaurant to visit.

data.title: A quiet, enjoyable place to dine
data.text: Pleasant atmosphere and great menu. Perfect for a relaxing lunch or dinner. We have lunch there at least once a week and dinner frequently with friends.  The wait staff are friendly, helpful and accommodating. The menu selection offers something for everyone and the restaurant has a full bar. Very classy but not pricey. It's my favorite place to dine in Concord.

data.title: Very, very nice
data.text: This is a cozy restaurant with a nice menu selection. And almost always a dinner special item. Desserts are good, too. Their service is super, and the food creations are delicious. It would be hard to be disappointed. This is a good dine-in location, but they do a=n excellent job on takeout as well.

data.title: Great place
data.text: I always enjoy Union street bistro, the food is always good and the servers are always friendly. Quaint location and atmosphere.

data.title: Quaint location and scrumptious food!
data.text: The BEST tomatoes basil soup I've ever had!  The bacon wrapped pork tenderloins were cooked perfectly and delivered by the chef himself. A quiet setting and great ambiance. Makes me wish this restaurant was in our hometown. I would be a frequent customer. Don't miss this restaurant if you are in Concord NC.

data.title: French fries on a salad.
data.text: We had a group of 6. The service was fair. The food was also fair. We had Brie as an appetizer and it was not warm enough to be spreadable. My salmon salad was good. I have no complaints about it. Other people in our group had lukewarm food served to them. It was decent, but I won't be in a hurry to go back.

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text: We eat at this restaurant quite often as it is unique and in the historic part of Concord. It has a great ambiance... Very quaint and cozy with a great menu. Everything is good. The salmon is excellent, as well as all the desserts! Definitely not a chain...... A little pricey, but atmosphere + food= well worth it!

data.title: SHORT AND SWEET
data.text:
I enjoyed myself and the lemon drop martinis
visited for a short and sweet birthday party
the set up was really nice and so were the people

data.title: What a great place
data.text:
We were looking for something different and stopped here for lunch. Sometimes these privately owned local restaurants are real gems. This is

We had lunch and just sandwiches but they were wonderful. We will definitely return.
